Action.author: kchristidis
Action.body: I generally agree, and thanks for writing this up. Is there any particular reason why we're calling these extended unit tests? I would think that we want are integration tests that work against the orderer binaries, i.e. all of this work should be done under the top-level `integration` package, and by extending `nwo`. Do you have something different in mind?

Action.author: adarshsaraf123
Action.body: ~yacovm I did not get the bit where you say, "check interoperability across the chains".

Action.author: yacovm
Action.body: We can't detect race conditions with integration tests and matt's framework is too crude for delicate corner case testing you can get in extended unit tests

Action.author: yacovm
Action.body: ~adarshsaraf123 i meant between the chains and the cluster code

Action.author: kchristidis
Action.body: Realistically, are we doing this? i.e. is there a need for a story around this?

Action.author: yacovm
Action.body: I don't see why not do that, however - IMO it's not something that should block us from releasing Raft.
